definition: to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.chinese: 小小說，“給這女孩子發獎。

sentences.english: Suggesting is one of the artistic techniques unique to short-short story.
sentences.chinese: 暗示，是小小說獨特的藝術技巧之一。

sentences.english: Since this year, an excellent work of short-short supermarket still is chosen to carry by offprint ceaselessly.
sentences.chinese: 今年以來，小小說超市的佳作依然不斷被選刊選載。

sentences.english: This small novel is very close to poetry in its spare and beautiful use of language and its use of symbols.
sentences.chinese: 這部小小說使用的美麗語言極其符號可與詩歌媲美。

sentences.english: The authors of the "little stories" are mostly new to the art of writing.
sentences.chinese: “小小說”的作者對於寫作技巧大都是生疏的。

definition: to play the same old tune (idiom); unoriginal
The Travels of Lao Tsan, novel by late Qing novelist Liu E 劉鶚|刘鹗[Liu2 E4]
Six Records of a Floating Life, autobiographical novel and description of Qing dynasty life by 沈復|沈复[Shen3 Fu4], published 1808
lit. a notch on the side of a boat to locate a sword dropped overboard (idiom); fig. an action made pointless by changed circumstances
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
Brandon Lee (1965-1993), American actor, son of Bruce Lee
